NAEB POLICY LETTER #5
^lb
November 15, l?5l
BILOXI:- “The only possible thing wrong was the weather”„ I’ve heard that state¬
ment many times since leaving Biloxi—together mth “The Best Everl“ and similar
remarks. Certainly no one could have attended and not been stimulated. People
w. 11 long discuss the Siepman talk — the Laswell proposal — the Coy performance
— the Sparkman spark — and on the lighter side the seafood and southern hos¬
pitality. The bus. ness meetings and the board meetings were also very well done
— the officers, new directors, and the convention site for 53 — how can we
help but expect even greater things from NAEB during the next stage of its
growth. Guess its up to Siegel to come up with a new'^label — I can’t think of
anything to follow “adrenilin“ — or aren’t we thru that stage yet?
VISITATIONS:- The southern trip made it possible for me to visit the follow.ng
places — and get more than the thumbnail impressions I list here. New Albany,
Ind.:- organization and coordination with a High School workshop group a revela¬
tion to a University operator — now they’re picking up the nighttime operations
idea — programming entirely from NAEB Tape Network features (a trend?)
Louisville, Ky.:- A pushing, shoving, hauling operation that is nevertheless
apparently quite sound. Don’t write off this wire idea for municipalities —
it makes plenty of sense from a service, and a financial, point of view.
University of Alabama:- Ausmus at his best. Use of persons trained on gaspips
radio seems to work — and each certainly has its place. Atlanta, Ga.:- Gaines
furnace blew up on him — much as I sympathised with Al — I was happy for the
opportunity to know Haskell Eoyter better. Another excellent operation — that
undoubtedly will expand to an adult education nighttime operation in the near
future...there’s plenty of material available for such expansion — and cer¬
tainly WABE is adequately equipped both staff wise and technically. University
of Tennessee:- Ken Wright finally remembers that we were commercial opponents
in the halcyon days of Cincinnati radio. He’s applying plenty of that know¬
how to the WOT operation. Needs both space and staff, but is making progress
in those directions. University of Kentucky:- Brorao is still the same. We
almost had a knockdown-dragout fight on the question of timing versus material
as a program determinant, .and he offered the first opposition to paying up for
network service — lately due to the fact that he’s only on the air 15 hours
weekly.
HERE AT URBAMA:- We’re still fighting the battle of the tapes...but think we’ll
have something definite to report most any day. The tape duplicator looks
somewhat more promising with Too good saying “I’ll more than likely have some¬
thing for you about Jan. 1" Keep your fingers crossed too — please 1’. Nice
long chats with Dallas Sirythe and Will Schramm. Dallas is working out that
"research design" deal I mentioned at Biloxi for this office. Promises to
come up with something in afew days. Schramm again ejp ressed his regrots at
not being able to attend the Biloxi meeting. Hudsons out of town for a week —
ditto Schooley. Frank at the SDX convention—a glutton for punishment huh?
Siebert and Lindley listened to all the Lasswell tapes today. Incidentally,
watch the program offering letter for an offering on the Biloxi tapes.
